A mix of some of his best work Most of these aren't separate songs, but rather old ones put together on 
one album. If you already have the other albums, just listen to them there. 
If not, this is a good album to start on- Some of his best work here. The 
only song specifically made new for this album is Fack, and that is on the 
list of his worst work, and that took away a star for me. Skip that and 
listen to the rest. This is the Eminem that the hip hop community found 
great, not the modern one that's soft and has no lyrical depth. Money 
changes people and their work, it happens to all artists. Eminem's golden 
age is long gone. This is back when he was original and had a good feel to 
it. Yeah, imagine that, I'm going against 'mainstream' opinion- since 
Relapse he has gone downhill.. Far downhill. Why is he so soft now? Afraid 
to hurt someone's feelings? Marshal Mathers LP 2 doesn't change that image. 
Em, tip; you can't go soft then expect to be considered cool again by 
calling someone a fag. Golden age of Eminem is summarized in this one 
album, it's a must-buy for all fans and people trying to get into it.

Eminem is... ...an excellent Rapper. I can't say he is the best rapper ever as some

best white Rapper I've ever heard to date. A lot of my friends can't stand 
him and I know it is due to the color of his skin (reverse racism if you're 
good, you're good). To: EMUINEM...Keep up the good work...you are awesome 
and one of the best out there. Tim

providing a variety of delicious ear candy guaranteed to satisfy nearly 
every music taste. Lyrically lush as well, "Storyteller" is the perfect 
choice for the title.

Very Underwhelming I was so excited for this album, but ended up disliking it when I listened 
to it. Carrie said it was going to contain more "twang," but I don't hear 
much at all. It's a pop album that's overproduced and most songs have 
similar, if not the same, themes. There are a few good and interesting 
songs, but overall it's not a great album. Blown Away was much better.

Love it!! This is one of her best albums!!! Her voice sounds great and I love the 
different sounds she's using both musically and vocally.

Storyteller The problem I've always had with Carrie is her overpowering voice, but I 
think she did a good on this album. This album has some great songs, my 
favorite being "Choctaw County Affair". It would have been better if it 
didn't include "Chaser", it sounds like any other country song to me to be 
honest. The scenario in "Church Bell" seems to familiar. It's like a cross 
between "Gunpowder and Lead" by Miranda Lambert and "Fancy" by Reba. 
Overall I liked most of the album and it's definitely my favorite by 
Carrie.

♡♡♡♡♡ LOVE what I've heard so far & can't wait to hear the rest!!!!!! ☆☆☆☆☆ Can't wait for this album to be released!! I LOVE the sound Carrie & her 
cowriters achieved & the direction this album is taking. She's at the top 
of her game & will undoubtedly draw a whole new listening audience with the 
country sound her new album upholds throughout -- unlike any of her 4 
previous albums. So excited to see her on tour again & to hear each 
individual track in their entirety! Long live Carrie & the beauty, class, 
integrity & unparalleled talent she brings to all she does! ❤❤

This is by far her best album she's released. Putting it simply, this album 
is fire. As the title suggests, these are amazing stories and everything 
just belongs here. Starting with the first single "Smoke Break" , which was 
a good enough country/twangy/rock song, turned out to be pretty average 
compared to the rest of the album. However, it's still pretty great and 
different from her other songs. "Choctaw County Affair" is one of the best 
songs, if not the best, of her career. This song is pure sass and has a 
very interesting storyline that deserves to be heard. While "Dirty Laundry" 
and "Church Bells" are #1 hits in the making. "Chaser", one of my all time 
favorites from her, "Relapse", and "Clock Don't Stop" could dominate the 
pop charts; all 3 being extremely catchy and addicting. Then there are 
songs like "Renegade Runaway" and "Mexico" that show off her impeccable 
strong vocals, making sure we know she's deserving of any female vocalist 
award in any genre. Taking it easy on the vocals, she also throws in some 
soft vocals. There are love songs such as: "Heartbeat" and "Like I'll Never 
Love You Again"(the best love song of her career). Both are a welcome 
addition to her catalogue. "The Girl You Think I Am" and "What I Never Knew 
I Always Wanted" are also beautifully written and very personal songs to 
Carrie. Overall, this album is stellar and deserves success. She worked 
hard on this album and you can tell through how great these songs are. 
Definitely worth a listen.

This is definitely one of her best! This album is amazing, you won't regret purchasing it!! She is already

Wow! I was really just planning on listening to another Carrie Underwood album. 
That is not a mean gesture at all. I love her music but after awhile it all 
starts to sound the same with most artists. This album, is different. 
Carrie sounds seasoned, the songs are intimate, and I absolutely love every 
single one. What I Never Knew I wanted is my personal favorite b/c it 
reflects me as well. This is by far her best album she's ever made.

I don't know about some people, but, well... Even though "Fight Song" seems to "empower" people to fight illnesses and 
bullying, that's great! However, if you think about this song a bit 
further, it's simply marketing (which I hope isn't Platten's intentions). 
This song also sounds like your normal, everyday generic pop. I don't know 
about some people, but "Fight Song" seems to DE-empower myself, and I 
simply hate this song in general. I have some problems with anxiety, but 
it's not empowering me at all to be confident in public speech or anything. 
I'm not trying to say that this is a bad song, and this shouldn't exist, so 
don't twist my words. This song is just not my taste, and I am not sure 
about how this song empowered other people. Not sure about "Lone Ranger" 
though, since no one is talking about it, and I haven't listened to that 
song.

made a landmark rock album. But I will just say this. Buy it,play it now.
